channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: American Heart Association says MagSafe could interfere with cardiac devices
item.description: Researchers suggest there’s a risk when Apple's iPhone 12 Pro Max is placed very close to pacemakers.

item.title: What to expect from Apple's online-only WWDC 2021
item.description: Google I/O is done, and so is Microsoft Build — that means Apple’s Worldwide Developers Conference is the last high-profile software showcase for at least a month. If you’re one to take Apple at its word, this year’s WWDC is shaping up to be the “biggest and best yet,” which leads us to the obvious question: what does the company plan to show off this year? Short answer: a lot.

item.title: Peleton discounts digital memberships for students, military and first responders
item.description: Peloton is cutting the price of its digital memberships for students, healthcare workers, teachers, first responders, military and military families.

item.title: Twitter Blue subscriptions launch in Canada and Australia first
item.description: Twitter's new “Twitter Blue” service, which gives users access to “exclusive” features for a few bucks a month, is launching in Canada and Australia.

item.title: Ford brings back the Maverick name for a new compact truck
item.description: Rumors about Ford's Maverick pickup have been floating around for a long time, and next week it will reveal the compact truck to the world.

item.title: WhatsApp is finally figuring out true multi-device support
item.description: WhatsApp has revealed that multi-device support is coming soon, letting you chat across four devices.

item.title: Vizio SmartCast TV owners no longer need two apps for YouTube and YouTube TV
item.description: Looking for YouTube TV on your SmartCast device? Check the main YouTube app, as it's moving there now.

item.title: Amazon adds fitness tests and posture-improving exercises to its Halo app
item.description: Amazon’s fitness wearable/platform Halo is getting a new feature. Movement Health aims to gauge and assess your functional fitness capabilities, which include stretching, twisting pushing, pulling and more.

item.title: The top video streaming services that are worth your money
item.description: Here's a list of the best video streaming services you can subscribe to in 2021, as chosen by Engadget editors.

item.title: The FBI says Russian ransomware group is behind meat supplier cyberattack
item.description: Operations are returning to full capacity at meat supplier JBS following a cyberattack that the FBI has attributed to the Russian group REvil.

item.title: The Morning After: Spotify's Only You lays out your weird music tastes
item.description:
Today’s tech headlines:
Spotify's 'Only You' feature shows how weird your musical tastes are, the next Sonos–Ikea collaboration is a speaker picture frame, and Donald Trump's blog is (already) dead.

item.title: Norton 360 antivirus will soon mine cryptocurrency
item.description: Norton 360 will soon come with a built-in miner that will enable users to mine for Ethereum.

item.title: Now Ring requires public requests from police seeking surveillance videos
item.description: Ring is making a significant change to how it plans to handle video requests from law enforcement agencies in the US.

item.title: New Philips Hue app makes it easier to automate your lights
item.description: Signify has released a brand new version of the Philips Hue application that gives you a quick way to control your smart lights.

item.title: Apple employees will return to the office in September
item.description: Apple CEO Tim Cook sent out an email to employees, asking them to work from the office thrice a week starting in September.

item.title: Samsung's new Galaxy Book Go laptops start at $349 with 18 hour battery life
item.description: Samsung has two cheap laptops on the way using Qualcomm's latest Snapdragon processors to run Windows 10.

item.title: The $5 per month Paramount+ Essential plan with ads launches June 7th
item.description: The half-price Paramount+ package with ads launches next week.

item.title: NASA will send two missions to Venus by 2030
item.description: NASA is returning to Venus for the first time since the 1990s.

item.title: China's gigantic multi-modal AI is no one-trick pony
item.description: Researchers from the Beijing Academy of Artificial Intelligence announced on Tuesday the release of Wu Dao, a mammoth AI seemingly capable of doing everything GPT-3 can do, and more.

item.title: Google makes it easier to find businesses with gender-neutral restrooms
item.description: With Pride Month underway, Google is adding a small but handy feature in Maps and Search to help transgender, nonbinary and gender non-conforming individuals.

item.title: Facebook is making it easier for researchers to study fringe groups
item.description: Facebook is making it easier for researchers to study its platform, including fringe groups and other “non-mainstream” movements, with a new Researcher API.

item.title: Microsoft expands its Airband internet access project to major cities
item.description: It aims to lower broadband service costs and help people obtain devices and digital skills.

item.title: Bill Nelson is delivering his first State of NASA address at 3PM ET
item.description: Tune in to NASA's YouTube channel at 3pm ET on Wednesday to watch Administrator Bill Nelson deliver his inaugural State of NASA address.

item.title: Lyft's first in-house ebike reflects light like a street sign
item.description: Lyft's new ebike features a built-in speaker system and LCD display, as well as host of other features.

item.title: HBO Max's $10 ad-supported plan is now available
item.description: Other tradeoffs include a 1080p streaming quality limit and no downloads for offline viewing.
